intro: Anisocapparis, commonly known as the rock caper, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Capparaceae. It is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit and the presence of distinctive, often spiny stems. The leaves are typically small, narrow, and arranged alternately along the stems. The flowers are usually yellow or white, with four petals and are borne in clusters. Anisocapparis species are native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa and are adapted to thrive in rocky, well-drained soils.
